messages.text:
Hello adonovan (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

PTAL


On Sat, Jul 27, 2013 at 3:31 AM, Rob Pike <r@golang.org> wrote:

> chunk mismatch
>

LGTM

https://codereview.appspot.com/11961043/diff/8001/src/pkg/math/big/rat.go
File src/pkg/math/big/rat.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/11961043/diff/8001/src/pkg/math/big/rat.go#newcode167
src/pkg/math/big/rat.go:167: // whether f represents x exactly. If |x| is too large to be represented
this notation is mathematically correct but confused me for a moment, and the only other place you use it is in explaining the absolute value function, which is not in one's mind here.. how about words instead?

If the magnitude of x is too large...

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=0d2637acc3bc ***

math/big: better documentation for Rat.Float64

R=adonovan, r
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/11961043

subject: code review 11961043: math/big: better documentation for Rat.Float64
